test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to verify that all products have a valid category_id and every category_id in products exists in the categories table
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any product has an invalid category_id or if there is a category_id in products that does not exist in the categories table
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END FROM products WHERE category_id NOT IN (SELECT category_id FROM categories)
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If it returns 0, the test fails

test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to verify that no products have a NULL value in mandatory fields (name, price)
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any product has a NULL value in either the name or price field
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END FROM products WHERE name IS NULL OR price IS NULL
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If it returns 0, the test fails

test_scenarios.description: This scenario is to verify that all foreign keys reference existing parent records and there are no orphan records in child tables
test_scenarios.test_scenario: Check if any foreign key in the child tables does not have a corresponding record in the parent table
test_scenarios.test_query: SELECT CASE WHEN COUNT(*) > 0 THEN 0 ELSE 1 END FROM child_table WHERE foreign_key NOT IN (SELECT primary_key FROM parent_table)
validation_criteria: If the query returns 1, the test passes. If it returns 0, the test fails
